title: Outgoing emails not saving to Send folder
creator: victor.J
content:
I am having a major issue with Thunderbird not saving Outgoing emails in Send Folder with IMAP setting.

Having three mailboxes two are set to IMAP and the third set to POP3. The IMAP outgoing mail creates an alert that mail was sent but copy not placed in your Sent folder due to network of file access errors.

Outgoing mail in POP3 save immediately to the Sent folder.

I am using the latest Thunderbird update:

  • Server Type: IMAP Mail Server
  • Server Name: IMAP.kinect.co.nz
  • Connect Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password

Outgoing Server [SMTP] Settings:

  • Description - User name
  • Server Name: smtp.kinect.co.nz
  • Port: 465
  • Connection security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication method: No authentication

Note: Authentication was changed form Normal Password in order to gain some traction on the issue during trouble, cause and correction actions.

Addendum: The PC was fitted to Starlink https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starlink in preparation for use as sole source for internet connection. That was abandoned due to email issues.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages", "/en-US/kb/difference-between-imap-and-pop3"]

title: How to undo "Run Spam Controls on Folder"
creator: Xenu
content: Brand new imported domain email account. I accidentally clicked on "Run Spam Controls on Folder" for the inbox for this account, and it marked over 4,000 emails as spam! How do I undo this? Delete the account and re-import it? I didn't set up any filters; I just set up a few tags, marked about 30 emails as spam, and deleted them. That's it.

title: Getting new messages
creator: liormic
content:
Hi, Lately I've been experiencing problems with Thunderbird (115.5.1 - 64bit). I have to shut down some apps and sometimes restart the computer in order to be able to get and send messages on my google account. Also, I can't get to the yahoo account and I get a new window to enter my username and password for yahoo but when I enter them, I get a "Something went wrong" notification and suggestion to try from a diffrent device. Everything was allways fine. What went wrong lately?

Thanks a lot, Mickey

title: Junk mail
creator: chipmess
content: Some Junk Mail (so far, only from my Outlook mail account) is appearing in my Inbox. This mail has a yellow banner at the top stating "Thunderbird thinks this message is Junk mail". Also on this banner is a button marked "Not Junk", that allows me to tell Thunderbird that it is not Junk. At the very top of the message (as with all messages) is a button marked "Junk", which in this case is "greyed out" and so won't work, although this button is not greyed out for messages that are not thought to be Junk!. This seems counter intuitive to me. Thunderbird is allowing some messages into the Inbox which it thinks are Junk, but disables the button that allows me to confirm it! I know that I can still mark the message as Junk by using the individual menu for the message (3 vertical dots), but why disallow the obvious "quick action" button?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Thunderbird/140.7.0;os:LMDE 6 Faye

title: Sent folder
creator: michael.royce
content:
I solved my problem.

I "Tools / Account Settings" / "Copies & Folders" unchecked & checked "Place a copy in:" and this solved my problem. Something became disconnected is someway.

title: Delete multiple messages and then can't read any others, have you noticed?
creator: robcabo-web
content: A bug perhaps:- If I highlight various messages at once (I use shift and arrow) and then I press delete. When i subsequently navigate to any other message I can't read it, instead I see this message until I quit and reload Thunderbird: We're sorry, but we can't display this conversation, because the messages have been moved or deleted. Has anyone else noticed this and, better still, do you know how to work around it. I'm using Unified Folders by the way, in case that's relevant.

title: Time Out Erro
creator: user4574
content:
Hi,

I had to re-install Thunderbird on my computer. I had it all working until Jan. 27th when all of the sudden most of my email accounts started giving a timeout error message. I have tried numerous setting changes and combinations, rechecked by passwords and even tried uninstalling and reinstalling again. Nothing is working. The accounts affected are gmail, yahoo, and aol accounts. I shut off my anti-virus software, and okayed thunderbird for accessing these accounts. Not sure what else to try, so thinking maybe it was a change with the mail servers and how they let thunderbird access them. Are they now denying the use of third party servers.

title: Sending email has problem with using SMTP password during a session
creator: stephen.driver
content: Since I upgraded to version 140.7.1esr (64-bit) Eclipse, I have been getting intermittent problems with sending emails. My settings for Thunderbird are to not remember passwords between sessions. When I send an email the first time in a session the supply of the password to the prompt is fine and the email is sent. But when I then send another email I get the invalid password prompt. If I use Enter New Password and put in the correct password the sending still fails. Sometimes if I delay and resend the message which has been saved, the process does work.

creator: ajpapics
content: Bonjour, j'utilise Thunderbird depuis plusieurs années et j'ai plusieurs comptes de messagerie. Je suis à la version 140.7.1esr. Depuis plusieurs jours, j'ai le message "Saisissez votre mot de passe pour alain.jouenne1@orange.fr". J'ai beau saisir le mot de passe, rien n'y fait. Ma config est Windows 10 64 bits, 3 adresses Gmail, 2 adresses Wanadoo et cette nouvelle adresse orange qui me pose problème. title: Odd behavior WRT "reply" ... sends to the "to address"  , from the "from address"  (ie does not swap)
creator: vetterlein
content:
My name is graeme , my wife Olivia.

I have many many messages from various people; if I reply to a a mail from "fred", Thunderbird creates a mail:

to: fred@xxxx from: graeme@xxxx

I have several messages from my wife , that behave in this same fashion (ie , as you would expect) but ONE message, when I reply the message displayed in Thunderbird (ie NOT YET SENT, so no SMTP etc yet involved) says:

(it does NOT have a REPLY-TO header BTW)

to: graeme@... from olivia@.....

...I've search back though my mailbox and all the mails from my wife work as you would expect, bar this one ...AND ONE OTHER that I found:

This says:

from olivia@.xxxx to: company@xxxx, olivia@xxxx. graeme@xxxxx

When I hit reply , it generates a message:

from olivia@xxxx to: company@xxxx, olivia@xxxx. graeme@xxxxx

So the from and to in the reply are exactly the same as the from/to in the initial message (they are not swapped)


So, to be clear 99% of messages are fine, it's just one or two cases where I get this odd behavior.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0;os:Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS;solver_id:80528

title: Message Filter window is too large for monitor and can't be reduced so you can OK the filter and save it
creator: buckeyejim3
content:
I use a 32" monitor. In Thunderbird, I want to create some Message Filters. I bring up the Message Filter window and enter a filter. When I go to click the OK button to save the filter, I cannot see the button on the screen so I try to scroll the window via the scroll bars to find it but it won't scroll. I next try to shrink the window by using the CTRL key plus the mouse scroll wheel but nothing happens.

I cannot see any way to create and save Message Filters in Thunderbird unless the window can be reduced. Why does Thunderbird NOT use Windows facilities? I can generally shrink or expand a window by the Windows facility of CTRL + scroll wheel, but not so in Thunderbird.

I need some direction, please.
